Package main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Command-line interface class that runs the game loop, and handles every object in the game.
    Author:
    Grant and Nick

    • Method Detail

      • setFarmName

        public void setFarmName​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Rrompts user to enter a name and sets it to that, after performing a check for validity. Used by the command-line interface only.
        Parameters:
        sc - a scanner object to capture user entry

      • isValidName

        public boolean isValidName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the given farm/farmer name is valid according to project requirements. (3-15 characters, alphabetical characters separated by single space, no extra spaces)
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        whether name is valid

      • setFarmerDetails

        public void setFarmerDetails​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Prompt user for their name and age. Used by the command-line interface.
        Parameters:
        sc - where to get user input from (usually System.in)

      • runGame

        public void runGame​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Runs the game from start to finish.
        Parameters:
        sc - where to get user input from (typically System.in)

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs the game upon execution of this program.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments to the program, unused
